message_1: What is the balanced chemical equation for the oxidation of ethylene (C2H4) with potassium permanganate (KMnO4), and what are the oxidation states of the carbon atoms before and after the reaction?
message_2:
The balanced chemical equation for the oxidation of ethylene (C2H4) with potassium permanganate (KMnO4) in an acidic medium is:

3 C2H4 + 2 KMnO4 + 4 H2SO4 â†’ 2 K2SO4 + 2 MnSO4 + 6 CH3COOH

In this reaction, ethylene (C2H4) is oxidized to acetic acid (CH3COOH) by potassium permanganate (KMnO4) in the presence of sulfuric acid (H2SO4). The potassium permanganate is reduced to manganese sulfate (MnSO4), and potassium sulfate (K2SO4) is also formed.

The oxidation states of the carbon atoms in ethylene (C2H4) are -2 for each carbon atom. In acetic acid (CH3COOH), the oxidation state of the carbon atom in the CH3 group is -3, while the oxidation state of the carbon atom in the COOH group is +3.
